You being new doesn't stop you from reading the page ubotu linked you to.
Okay, here's the jist. When you want to run something as root, you put "sudo" before the command.
if what you are running is a graphical application, you use "gksudo"
Run this: sudo apt-get install sun-java6-jre

Yeah, I'll explain it. "sudo" gives you root, as we've discussed. "apt-get" is a package managing application - it managers what is installed on your computer. "install" is what you're telling apt-get to do. "sun-java6-jre" is the package you're installing.
